page.title: 09THE LANDSCAPE OF FORTHAMPTON
page.content: A large part of the block is owned by the Yorke Estates who altogether own 3000 acres of land. They actually farm 800 acres and let the rest to tenant farmers. Mnay of these families have farmed the land for several generations and hoped a few years ago to be able to buy their land but the Estate decided against selling. Most of the area is given over to mixed farming, especially cereals, beef cattle and sheep. Two local farmers also maintain dairy herds. There is a slight bias towards pasture land. There used to be many orchards here but no fruit is now grown in the area. There is still a lot of scattered woodland and, although farming is no longer a major employer, the landscape reflects a picture little changed for centuries.
